column4: has anyone had avi files to play strangely in mediaplayer - having a coloured overlay that eventually clears until you skip forward and then it appears again and also jumping forward moving more in terms of time than it should?
i suspect a codec issue but have the windows codecs installed
does it affect all players?
have you tried switching video output method?
vlc has the option in preferences. Try a few. X11 is usually pretty solid
try a few, see if it gets better
use mount in CLI may work. You will need the proprietary virtualbox for native usb access
I'd ask in #vbox
there is no single best
I doubt they have any 'agreement' its just the platforms they are choosing to support
possible, but not confirmable ;)
i'd say so considering you can setup an SFTP server on your PC and port forward though the router. You can then access your data anywhere
you can compare stuff like that in any purchasing situation
i dunno, the rhythmnbox plugin is pretty decent, but it should get cheaper over time I guess.
should be, yes
how big is the screen playing them?
i'd just look at actual throughput
I'd ask in ##hardware about that
unless you have a big screen, you don't need 1080P
your system will cache some to RAM as it'splayed, you'll be fine
##hardware   again
